title: Oh No, the Beans
description:
Referenced in this episode:

  • Extra-Creamy Beans From Scratch—Without Babysitting (Food52)
  • Rich & Creamy Beans from Rachel Roddy (Genius Recipes | YouTube)

Genius-Hunter Extra-Credit:

  • What to do with all those beans? 
  • A fat-bellied bean flask 

Special thanks to listeners Nicole (@nicolelucille87) and Lu (@luau21) for sharing your cozy bean memories. Got a genius lead, bean-based or otherwise? Email it to me at genius@food52.com.
author: podcasts@food52.com (Kristen Miglore, Rachel Roddy)
content:encoded:

Special thanks to listeners Nicole (@nicolelucille87) and Lu (@luau21) for sharing your cozy bean memories. Got a genius lead, bean-based or otherwise? Email it to me at genius@food52.com.
itunes:title: Oh No, the Beans
itunes:author: Kristen Miglore, Rachel Roddy
itunes:summary: Undercooked (or worse, burnt) beans begone. 'The Guardian' columnist Rachel Roddy joins Kristen to talk the Maremmani method of throwing a flask of beans onto embers, and why it yields perfectly plump, tender beans every time.
itunes:subtitle: Undercooked (or worse, burnt) beans begone. 'The Guardian' columnist Rachel Roddy joins Kristen to talk the Maremmani method of throwing a flask of beans onto embers, and why it yields perfectly plump, tender beans every time.
itunes:keywords: food podcast, food52, food interview, chef interview, white beans recipe, genius recipe, rachel roddy, tuscan beans recipe, kristen miglore, flask beans recipe
